title: Tighten About page title/location vertical spacing in left column

requirements.summary: Reduce vertical spacing under the role title and location in the About page left column while preserving all text, typography, alignment, and layout structure across breakpoints.
acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/pages/AboutPage.tsx, the spacing for the title/location block under the profile image is reduced (e.g., by lowering the margin-top and/or vertical gaps) without altering any text content.
No font sizes, font weights, alignment, or grid/column structure are changed; only spacing-related Tailwind classes are modified.

On both mobile and desktop breakpoints, the role title and location sit closer together and/or closer to the profile image compared to current behavior, reducing the perceived empty space in the left column.
No regression to responsiveness: the layout remains centered and aligned as before across breakpoints.

file_operations.description: Adjust only spacing-related Tailwind classes in the left-column title/location block under the profile image (e.g., reduce the container's top margin like mt-6 and/or reduce vertical gap like space-y-3) to decrease empty vertical space while keeping text, typography classes, alignment, and grid/column structure unchanged on both mobile and desktop.
